title: Wine and War_The French the Nazis, and the Battle for France's G
description:
The remarkable untold story of FranceÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s courageous, clever vinters who protected and rescued the countryÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s most treasured commodity from German plunder during World War II.

"To be a Frenchman means to fight for your country and its wine."
Ã¢â‚¬â€œClaude Terrail, owner, Restaurant La Tour dÃ¢â‚¬â„¢Argent

In 1940, France fell to the Nazis and almost immediately the German army began a campaign of pillaging one of the assets the French hold most dear: their wine. Like others in the French Resistance, winemakers mobilized to oppose their occupiers, but the tale of their extraordinary efforts has remained largely unknownÃ¢â‚¬â€œuntil now. This is the thrilling and harrowing story of the French wine producers who undertook ingenious, daring measures to save their cherished crops and bottles as the Germans closed in on them. Wine and War illuminates a compelling, little-known chapter of history, and stands as a tribute to extraordinary individuals who waged a battle that, in a very real way, saved the spirit of France.
